hanzi-su-wiki:
駒

Значения

Жеребёнок, пешка, шашка

Мнемоника

Жеребенок, молодая лошадь 馬. Оглашает воздух беспрестанным ржанием — фразами 句 своего, лошадиного языка.

Варианты

驹

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 驹)
Pictophonetic: 句 indicates the sound; 馬 (horse) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 駒子 [ jū zi ]: young horse, ass or mule; foal; colt; filly
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 馬 [ mǎ ] horse; surname
    • 句 [jùgou1] sentence, clause, phrase, paragraph; stanza
heisig_constituent: pony, team of horses, phrase, bound up, mouth
heisig_story: Team of horses . . . phrase. In American slang, a pony is an underground translation of a classical text, which students who cannot manage the difficult phrases of the original language consult and pass on from one generation to the next.
koohiiStory1: The new My Little Ponies show is all about magic horses who utter cute catch phrases.
koohiiStory2: A particular My Little Pony has a string that when you pull it, it repeats the same dumb phrase like "I love you".
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The horse who can write a paragraph gets to be a chess piece. Only the most erudite of horses gets selected to be a chess piece. The knight’s chess piece is represented by a horse, and for a horse to earn this honor, they must first write a paragraph explaining why they deserve the honor.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine a horse trying to write a paragraph about why it deserves to be a chess piece. See the horse struggle with his hooves to write out a paragraph as he neighs in nervous frustration.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Upon being told that he will never be a chess piece, the horse slips into a coma (こま). The horse will never awaken from this coma as he knows he will never fulfill his dream of becoming a chess piece, so he has nothing to live for.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: See this horse in its coma. You feel bad that it will never be able to be a chess piece, but this is a bit dramatic.
Ru_Russian: лошадь, конь, пони, жеребёнок; шахматная фигура, шашка, пешка
Ru_Notes: [строевая] лошадь, [боевой] конь; жеребёнок, лошадка, пони; фигура (шахматная), шашка, пешка; [деревянная] распорка; кобылка (муз. инструмента)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the horse (馬) in the verse (句) is a pony
humanum_full_description_en:
" Ju " starts from " horse " and " sentence ". The original meaning is a two-year-old horse, which is extended to a young horse. "Shuowen": "Ju, a horse at two years old is called a horse, and three years old is called a horse. From the horse, the sentence sounds." "Poetry. "Hanguang": "Speaking of a horse", Mao Heng's biography: "Five feet or more is a horse." "Poetry. "Zhulin": "Ride me on the horse" Zheng Xuanjian: "A horse below six feet is a horse."

Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning, Daxun: "Wang Yi (given) Daju." It means that Zhou Wang bestowed Daju. It is also used as the name of the person, and the father of the horse will cover: "The father of the horse will always use it forever.
humanum_short_description_en: The original meaning of " horse " is a two-year-old horse, which generally refers to a young and strong horse.
humanum_full_description:
「駒」從「馬」，「句」聲，本義是兩歲馬，引申為少壯的馬。《說文》：「駒，馬二歲曰駒，三歲曰駣。从馬，句聲。」《詩．漢廣》：「言秣其駒」，毛亨傳：「五尺以上曰駒。」《詩．株林》：「乘我乘駒」鄭玄箋：「馬六尺以下曰駒。」

　　金文用作本義，達盨：「王易(賜)達駒。」表示周王賜駒給達。又用作人名，駒父盨蓋：「駒父其萬年永用多休。」
humanum_short_description: 「駒」本義是兩歲的馬，泛指年輕力壯的馬。

①少壯的駿馬，有時用以喻少年英俊的人：千里駒(ａ．千里馬；b．喻年輕有力的人)。白駒過隙；駒隙；駒陰；駒光(均形容時間過得很快，就像駿馬在縫隙前一掠而過)。
②小馬，又指小驢、小騾：馬駒子。驢駒子。
駒子 [ jū zi ]: young horse, ass or mule; foal; colt; filly

Hanzi: 驹
Lesson: 54 frameNoV4: 1979 frameNoV6: 2133 Strokes: 15 Jouyou Grade: JH JLPT: 1

「 駒 」從「 馬 」，「 句 」聲，本義是兩歲馬，引申為少壯的馬。《說文》：「駒，馬二歲曰駒，三歲曰駣。从馬，句聲。」《詩．漢廣》：「言秣其駒」，毛亨傳：「五尺以上曰駒。」《詩．株林》：「乘我乘駒」鄭玄箋：「馬六尺以下曰駒。」 金文用作本義，達盨：「王易(賜)達駒。」表示周王賜駒給達。又用作人名，駒父盨蓋：「駒父其萬年永用多休。」
" Ju" starts from " horse" and " sentence". The original meaning is a two-year-old horse, which is extended to a young horse. "Shuowen": "Ju, a horse at two years old is called a horse, and three years old is called a horse. From the horse, the sentence sounds." "Poetry. "Hanguang": "Speaking of a horse", Mao Heng's biography: "Five feet or more is a horse." "Poetry. "Zhulin": "Ride me on the horse" Zheng Xuanjian: "A horse below six feet is a horse." Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning, Daxun: "Wang Yi (given) Daju." It means that Zhou Wang bestowed Daju. It is also used as the name of the person, and the father of the horse will cover: "The father of the horse will always use it forever.

駒字的基本解释

駒
jū
见“驹”。

駒字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jū］
［《廣韻》舉朱切，平虞，見。］
“驹1”的繁体字。
(1)二岁的马。泛指少壮的马。
(2)幼兽。
(3)喻年少英俊的人。
(4)通“驕”。六尺高的马。
(5)姓。汉有駒幾。见《汉书·景武昭宣元成功臣表》。
[②]［jù］
［《集韻》俱遇切，去遇，見。］
“驹2”的繁体字。
见“駒2麗”。

駒字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【馬字部】　駒； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1436第05
【唐韻】舉朱切【集韻】【韻會】恭于切，?音拘。【說文】馬二歲曰駒。【註】六尺以上馬，五尺以上駒。【爾雅·釋獸】伭駒，褭驂。【註】伭駒，小馬，別名褭驂。或曰此卽腰褭，古之良馬名。【周禮·夏官·廋人】攻駒。【註】攻駒，騬其蹄齧者。又【校人】月令【註】執駒，無令近母，猶攻駒也。又【禮·月令】仲夏，游牝別羣，則縶騰駒。【註】季春妊孕已遂，故仲夏不使同羣，拘繫騰躍之駒，防踶齧。　又驪駒，歌名。【前漢·儒林傳】王式謂歌吹諸生曰：歌驪駒。【註】服虔曰：逸《詩》篇名，見《大戴禮》，客欲去歌之。　又元駒，魚名。【崔豹·古今注】兗州人呼赤鯉爲元駒。又蟻別名。　又株駒，枯樹本也。【列子·天瑞篇】若橜株駒。　又姓，周駒伯，漢駒幾，見【萬姓統譜】。　又【集韻】俱遇切，音句。義同。【詩·小雅】老馬反爲駒，不顧其後。集傳駒，叶去聲。　又【集韻】駒驪，國名。　又叶居侯切，音鉤。【易林】川深難游，水爲我憂。多虛少實，命鹿爲駒。

考證：〔【周禮

Horse
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jū］
["Guang Yun" Zhu Qi, Ping Yu, see. ]
Traditional characters for "ju1".
(1) A two-year-old horse. Refers to young and strong horses in general.
(2) Cubs.
(3) Yu is a young and handsome man.
(4) Through "arrogance". A six-foot-tall horse.
(5) Last name. Han has a few horses. See "Book of Han·Jing Wuzhao Xuan Yuan Success Minister Table".
[②]［jù］
["Jiyun" all meets, meets, meets. ]
Traditional characters for "Ju 2".
See "Ju 2 Li".

Horse
Name meaning
Nothing.
jū, jù
вм. 驹
Radicals: 馬, 句  (horse, paragraph)
Meaning Mnemonic
The horse who can write a paragraph gets to be a chess piece. Only the most erudite of horses gets selected to be a chess piece. The knight’s chess piece is represented by a horse, and for a horse to earn this honor, they must first write a paragraph explaining why they deserve the honor.
Imagine a horse trying to write a paragraph about why it deserves to be a chess piece. See the horse struggle with his hooves to write out a paragraph as he neighs in nervous frustration.
Reading Mnemonic
Upon being told that he will never be a chess piece, the horse slips into a coma (こま). The horse will never awaken from this coma as he knows he will never fulfill his dream of becoming a chess piece, so he has nothing to live for.
See this horse in its coma. You feel bad that it will never be able to be a chess piece, but this is a bit dramatic.
